channel.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
channel.description:
Ok,I'm getting pretty ticked off now! I'm running a Vista x64 bit,It worked on my regular Windows XP computer... I keep getting a error when I click to move on my Client it completely crashes I've reinstalled JDK like twice now and It hasn't Fixed the problem!
[code]# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d841d46, pid=16724, tid=16436 # # JRE version: 6.0_16-b01 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (14.2-b01 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x51d46] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #[/code]
Is it my computer? My client? My JDK? I have no idea!
For the sake of my sanity please help!
Code God of RS
And don't flame me for posting here it has to do with JDK!

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

[quote=“scenemo, post:19, topic:330142”]if you open your client up. and it crashes on the second click then you need to edit your run.bat in ur client. right click the run.bat or whatever and changed the word java (should be second to last sentence) and replace with “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javac”
It changes depending on what jre you have some are jre1.6_14 and etc… and depending on what program in the bin folder that runs it… maybe just called java or javaw…

hope this helped cuz it helped for 4/4 players that play my ps :)[/quote]

Was there a need to grave dig?

Read full topic

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @scenemo scenemo
item.description:
@scenemo wrote:

if you open your client up. and it crashes on the second click then you need to edit your run.bat in ur client. right click the run.bat or whatever and changed the word java (should be second to last sentence) and replace with “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javac”
It changes depending on what jre you have some are jre1.6_14 and etc… and depending on what program in the bin folder that runs it… maybe just called java or javaw…

hope this helped cuz it helped for 4/4 players that play my ps

Read full topic

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You know, this isn’t just a problem with the 64-bit JDK, or with 508 servers, it seems to be a problem with Java 1.6 all together. These are both of the JDKs I have:

$ java -version java version "1.6.0_16" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_16-b01) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 14.2-b01, mixed mode) $ java32 -version java version "1.6.0_18" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_18-b07) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 16.0-b13, mixed mode)

And both of them crash on the second click with 317 and 508. However, with the same code, it runs fine under this JVM:

$ java5 -version java version "1.5.0_22" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_22-b03) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_22-b03, mixed mode)

Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:330142”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=426519.msg3132884#msg3132884 date=1266650907]
The solution to this method really should be stickied. It’s starting to be asked a lot.
[/quote]
done. (It’s in the client hacking section)

Do you think we could report this as a bug to sun/oracle?[/quote]

Definitely, if we can isolate the problem and come up with a single example class that causes it. Mind extracting the particular offending method Taharok? Or telling me which one it is at least.

Read full topic

@code_god_of_rs wrote:

Its all fixed! Thanks to everything I did in fat Cookies stickie and this post I came up with a way to completely fix it! I would like to post it but,I’m not sure if it would be allowed with a stickie like it already in place!
What I would post is more refined and described For Complete Newbies! Can i?

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @code_god_of_rs code god of rs
item.description:
@code_god_of_rs wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:13, topic:330142”][quote author=code god of rs link=topic=426519.msg3132892#msg3132892 date=1266651469]

Ahhhh,Got ya! So,What do I do to fix my problem?
New Jdk?
Running the JDK for x64 bit!

Yes, install the 32 bit JDK as well as the 32 bit JRE. They should both be located in [tt]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java[/tt] when you are done.

So when it asks for platform on the Download page just click Windows?
Then Set-up the paths like normal in the FAQ?
[/quote]

Yes, but make sure the download is 32-bit/x86, not 64-bit/x64.[/quote]

I clicked windows,It didn’t Specify anywhere if it was 32-bit,But the options were:
Windows – I clicked this one
Windows x64

I installed it and got the SAME error!
I’ll try again and uninstall…

(Nvm one min forgot to uninstall 64 bit one in the first place!)

[After I only have windows x34 JDK on my computer]
Paths set the whole thing and its not recognizing the java now!
I think i’m completely Messed up in this… Nothings working! >.<

Btw both paths start with: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\
Is this fine? (These are just snippits of real path the real paths have the rest of the stuff on them too)

Read full topic

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“code god of rs, post:12, topic:330142”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=426519.msg3132891#msg3132891 date=1266651284]

Ahhhh,Got ya! So,What do I do to fix my problem?
New Jdk?
Running the JDK for x64 bit!

Yes, install the 32 bit JDK as well as the 32 bit JRE. They should both be located in [tt]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java[/tt] when you are done.
[/quote]
So when it asks for platform on the Download page just click Windows?
Then Set-up the paths like normal in the FAQ?[/quote]

Yes, but make sure the download is 32-bit/x86, not 64-bit/x64.

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t have this problem with the 64-bit sun java version under linux. Perhaps it is a windows only problem, but if in fact that is the issue it needs to be reported to sun.

[quote=“code god of rs, post:7, topic:330142”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=426519.msg3132884#msg3132884 date=1266650907]
The solution to this method really should be stickied. It’s starting to be asked a lot.

To put it frankly, the 64 bit JIT compiler inside the VM has troubles compiling the walking algorithm to native code, hence the reason the client crashes when you start walking. I don’t know if there are equal problems in the other distributions of the 64 bit runtime environment-- I’ve never been interested enough to check.

I don’t know enough about the VM to speculate as to exactly what the root cause is, but the solution is simple. Use a 32 bit VM instead.
[/quote]

VM? Does that stand for Virtual Machine? Because i’m not using one…

Sorry,Kinda outa sorts with the lingo on the forums![/quote]

Java programs run in the JVM, the Java Virtual Machine. So if you are running a java program, you are running a virtual machine.

Read full topic

item.title: JDK crashes my RS client! >.<
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“code god of rs, post:7, topic:330142”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=426519.msg3132884#msg3132884 date=1266650907]
The solution to this method really should be stickied. It’s starting to be asked a lot.

To put it frankly, the 64 bit JIT compiler inside the VM has troubles compiling the walking algorithm to native code, hence the reason the client crashes when you start walking. I don’t know if there are equal problems in the other distributions of the 64 bit runtime environment-- I’ve never been interested enough to check.

I don’t know enough about the VM to speculate as to exactly what the root cause is, but the solution is simple. Use a 32 bit VM instead.
[/quote]

VM? Does that stand for Virtual Machine? Because i’m not using one…

Sorry,Kinda outa sorts with the lingo on the forums![/quote]

Yes, it stands for Virtual Machine. The JRE (Java Runtime Environment) includes the Java Virtual Machine.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The solution to this method really should be stickied. It’s starting to be asked a lot.

To put it frankly, the 64 bit JIT compiler inside the VM has troubles compiling the walking algorithm to native code, hence the reason the client crashes when you start walking. I don’t know if there are equal problems in the other distributions of the 64 bit runtime environment-- I’ve never been interested enough to check.

I don’t know enough about the VM to speculate as to exactly what the root cause is, but the solution is simple. Use a 32 bit VM instead.
